description: Difference between number of prime factors of n and of EulerPhi(n).
comments: Prime factors counted without multiplicity. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 03 2016The first term with an absolute value greater than 2 is a(211); the first term with an absolute value greater than 3 is a(2311); the first term with an absolute value greater than 4 is a(43891). - _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 03 2016
example: n=105,Phi(n)=48, with 3 or 2 prime-factors respectively, so a(105)=3-2=1
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 11 2000
